summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting discovery materials including photographs and documents received from victims not referenced in the indictment. The letter confirms compliance with a court order and notes the materials are governed by a protective order.

events.title: Court Order for Discovery Disclosure
events.description: The Court issued an order directing the Government to disclose specific discovery materials by March 12, 2021.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Production to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials, including photographs and documents from victims, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials stamped SDNY_GM_02742963 through SDNY_GM_02743100 to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.
The produced materials include photographs and documents received from victims who were not referenced in the indictment (No. S1 20 Cr. 330).
The production was made pursuant to a court order dated November 18, 2020, and is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The letter itself is designated as 'confidential' because it references materials designated as confidential under the protective order.
The government acknowledges its ongoing discovery obligations and commits to promptly producing any additional discoverable material.
